meanings.definition: To tease or make fun of someone in a playful or unkind way.
meanings.sent1: The kids were ragging on their friend for wearing mismatched socks.
meanings.sent2: Stop ragging on your little brother; he's trying his best.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were ragging each other, but it was all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: Her classmates were ragging on her, but she didn't let it bother her.
meanings.sent5: The comedian enjoyed ragging on the audience during his stand-up routine.

meanings.definition: A piece of old cloth used for cleaning or wiping.
meanings.sent1: She used a ragging to wipe the spilled milk off the table.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic always keeps a ragging in his toolbox for greasy hands.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the ragging, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The old man carried a ragging in his pocket to clean his glasses.
meanings.sent5: The maid used a damp ragging to dust the furniture.
